item.title: Laura add a quote by Margaret Wolfe Hamilton Hungerford
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder." -- Margaret Wolfe Hamilton Hungerford

item.title: Laura add a quote by Lauren Weisberger
item.description: "Oh, don't be silly - EVERYONE wants this. Everyone wants to be *us*." -- Lauren Weisberger

item.title: Laura add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Laura add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Laura add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Laura add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "People, generally, suck." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Laura add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "The role of a writer is not to say what we can all say, but what we are unable to say." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Laura add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "People shouldn't be afraid of their government. Governments should be afraid of their people." -- Alan Moore

item.title: Laura add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Laura add a quote by Jon Stewart
item.description: "I've been to Canada, and I've always gotten the impression that I could take the country over in about two days." -- Jon Stewart

item.title: Laura add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Laura add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "We write to taste life twice, in the moment and in retrospect." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Laura add a quote by Helvy Tiana Rosa
item.description: "You are what you write." -- Helvy Tiana Rosa

item.title: Laura add a quote by Meg Cabot
item.description: "Write the kind of story you would like to read. People will give you all sorts of advice about writing, but if you are not writing something you like, no one else will like it either." -- Meg Cabot

item.title: Laura add a quote by Henri Matisse
item.description: "Creativity takes courage. " -- Henri Matisse

item.title: Laura add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "And by the way, everything in life is writable about if you have the outgoing guts to do it, and the imagination to improvise. The worst enemy to creativity is self-doubt." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Laura add a quote by Stephen Colbert
item.description: "If our Founding Fathers wanted us to care about the rest of the world, they wouldn't have declared their independence from it." -- Stephen Colbert

item.title: Laura add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "If my doctor told me I had only six minutes to live, I wouldn't brood. I'd type a little faster." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Laura add a quote by John Milton
item.description: "The mind is its own place, and in itself can make a heaven of hell, a hell of heaven.." -- John Milton

item.title: Laura add a quote by Oliver James
item.description: "Music is my higher power" -- Oliver James

item.title: Laura add a quote by Sir Francis Bacon
item.description: "Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly." -- Sir Francis Bacon

item.title: Laura add a quote by Jon Stewart
item.description: "If America leads a blessed life, then why did God put all of our oil under people who hate us?" -- Jon Stewart

item.title: Laura add a quote by Jon Stewart
item.description: "Religion. It's given people hope in a world torn apart by religion." -- Jon Stewart

item.title: Laura add a quote by Stephen Colbert
item.description: "Atheism, a religion dedicated to its own sense of smug superiority." -- Stephen Colbert

item.title: Laura add a quote by Quentin Crisp
item.description: "The young always have the same problem - how to rebel and conform at the same time. They have now solved this by defying their parents and copying one another." -- Quentin Crisp

item.title: Laura add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The best way to keep children at home is to make the home atmosphere pleasant, and let the air out of the tires." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Laura add a quote by Fran Lebowitz
item.description: "In real life, I assure you, there is no such thing as algebra. " -- Fran Lebowitz

item.title: Laura add a quote by Bill Keane
item.description: "Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is a gift of God, which is why we call it the present." -- Bill Keane

item.title: Laura add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "Stories never really end...even if the books like to pretend they do. Stories always go on. They don't end on the last page, any more than they begin on the first page." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Laura add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "Books have to be heavy because the whole world's inside them." -- Cornelia Funke
